metadata.title: Karate Do Neuhausen
metadata.description: Traditional Shotokan Karate for children, youth and adults in Munich

hero.title: Build self-confidence through structured Shotokan Karate
hero.subtitle: We teach children clear physical and mental skills in a structured karate program. Parents receive a predictable training path with measurable progress.

valueProps.heading: Traditional Shotokan Karate
valueProps.subtitle: Structured training for children, youth, and adults. Qualified instruction by experienced trainers with high Dan grades.

items.title: Structured Training
items.body: Systematic progression from basic techniques to advanced kata. Clear training plans for each age group.

items.title: Qualified Trainers
items.body: Instruction by trainers with 7th and 8th Dan. Long-standing experience in teaching traditional karate values.

items.title: Age-Appropriate Programs
items.body: Special training programs for children from age 6, youth, and adults. Each group trains according to their developmental level.

items.title: Traditional Values
items.body: Teaching discipline, respect, and self-control. Long-term development of body and mind.

deepDive.heading: The Training Path
deepDive.subtitle: From fundamentals to mastery. A structured path with clear goals and measurable progress.

steps.title: Learn Fundamentals
steps.body: Systematic development of basic techniques. Kihon, Kata, and Kumite are taught step by step.

steps.title: Regular Training
steps.body: Two training sessions per week for continuous development. Predictable schedule for long-term participation.

steps.title: Progress and Grading
steps.body: Clear examination structure with measurable progress. Regular belt examinations document the development path.

useCases.heading: Who is Karate suitable for
useCases.subtitle: Shotokan Karate is for everyone who values structured training and traditional values.

items.title: Children from age 6
items.body: Age-appropriate training promotes coordination, concentration, and self-confidence. Clear structures provide security.

items.title: Youth
items.body: Training supports personal development in an important life phase. Discipline and respect are fostered.

items.title: Adults
items.body: Physical fitness and mental balance through traditional karate. Entry possible at any time.

items.title: Families
items.body: Training together strengthens cohesion. Parents and children can train in parallel.

pricing.heading: Pricing
pricing.subtitle: Two training sessions per week. Predictable schedule for continuous development.

plans.title: Children
plans.body: For children from 6–14 years. Age-appropriate training program with Shotokan training plan.

plans.title: Teen
plans.body: For teens from 15–17 years. Shotokan training program with instruction by trainers with 7th and 8th Dan.
features: Instruction by trainers with 7th and 8th Dan

plans.title: Adult
plans.body: For adults from 18 years. Shotokan training program with instruction by trainers with 7th and 8th Dan.
features: Instruction by trainers with 7th and 8th Dan

faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers to the most important questions about training and membership.

items.question: At what age can children start with karate?
items.answer: Children can start training from age 6. The program is designed age-appropriately and promotes coordination, concentration, and self-confidence.

items.question: How often does training take place?
items.answer: Training takes place twice per week. The times are fixed and enable continuous development.

items.question: Do I need prior experience?
items.answer: No, prior experience is not required. Training begins with the fundamentals and builds systematically.

items.question: What is Shotokan Karate?
items.answer: Shotokan is a traditional karate style based on discipline, respect, and systematic training. Techniques are taught in Kihon, Kata, and Kumite.

items.question: How does a trial lesson work?
items.answer: In the trial lesson, you get to know the training and can ask questions. Registration in advance is required.

items.question: What equipment is needed?
items.answer: Comfortable sportswear is sufficient to start. A karate gi will be needed later and can be discussed after the trial lesson.

testimonials.heading: What participants say
testimonials.subtitle: Experiences from children, youth, and adults in training.

testimonials.description: Our child has developed significantly more self-confidence through structured training. The clear rules and respectful interaction also have a positive effect on school.
Training provides a good balance to professional life. The structured approach and traditional values make the training particularly valuable.
Karate helps me develop discipline and self-control. The regular examinations clearly show me my progress.

finalCta.heading: Start your child's self-confidence journey
finalCta.subtitle: Your child learns clear skills through structured Shotokan training.
